thread.title: 12 convicted over 2006 Mumbai train blasts
thread.title_full: 12 convicted over 2006 Mumbai train blasts | News24

author: news24.com
title: 12 convicted over 2006 Mumbai train blasts
text:
New Delhi (dpa) - An Indian court on Friday convicted 12 men for bombings on Mumbai's train network in 2006 that killed at least 200 people, lawyers said.
A special trial court in Mumbai acquitted one defendant in the case, special public prosecutor Raja Thakare told reporters outside the court.
"The sentencing will take place on Monday," he said. The men were convicted of charges including murder and conspiracy.
All of the accused were members of the banned Students Islamic Movement of India. Indian security agencies say the group planned the bombings with help from Pakistan's Lashkar-e-Taiba group.
